key_risks: Significant financial instability with a net loss of $45.5 million in Q3 2024 and a 28% workforce reduction
Project cancellations and delays, including the cancellation of the Carbon Free Power Project (CFPP)
Regulatory hurdles and potential cost overruns, with historical data showing 175 out of 180 nuclear projects globally exceeding budgets by an average of 117%
Public skepticism and safety concerns regarding nuclear energy and radioactive waste
Stiff competition from other SMR developers and alternative clean energy technologies
controversies: Cancellation of the flagship Carbon Free Power Project (CFPP)
Public skepticism and safety concerns related to nuclear energy
Reliance on government support and partnerships, which could be disrupted
environmental_issues: Generation of radioactive waste comparable to traditional nuclear plants
social_issues: Public skepticism and safety concerns regarding nuclear energy
governance_issues: Financial instability and reliance on external funding and partnerships
Regulatory hurdles and potential delays in project execution
